2018-09-30T11:00:04Z: Driver, TeamHamilton, MercedesBottas, MercedesVettel, FerrariRaikkonen, FerrariVerstappen, Red BullRicciardo, Red BullLeclerc, SauberMagnussen, HaasOcon, Force IndiaPerez, Force India
2018-09-30T13:04:59Z: It's a bit strange to end our coverage in such subdued circumstances after a pretty entertaining race, but we're out of time. Thanks for joining us for the Russian Grand Prix and its twists, turns and team orders. Look out for all the reaction to the race, including Mercedes' in-race swap, on Autosport and Motorsport.com this evening. Lewis Hamilton wins F1 Russian GP after Mercedes team ordersLewis Hamilton extended his Formula 1 title advantage over Sebastian Vettel with victory in the Russian Grand Prix after Mercedes ordered Valtteri Bottas to move aside
2018-09-30T12:59:52Z: Vettel - who in normal circumstances would probably be the unhappiest man on that podium - is liveliest of the top three as he receives his trophy.
2018-09-30T12:58:52Z: It's a very strange atmosphere on the podium. Hamilton's reaction is very subdued as he receives his winners' trophy from Putin.
2018-09-30T12:56:55Z: The drivers are now on the podium with the British national anthem playing out, and have been joined by Vladimir Putin.
2018-09-30T12:54:13Z: This was about as intimate as things got between the two Mercedes drivers
2018-09-30T12:47:23Z: Hamilton is now walking away from Paul di Resta, who just about catches up with the race winner to grab an interview!
2018-09-30T12:46:51Z: Hamilton looks sheepish as he climbs from his car and heads over to Bottas, and there's a subdued meeting of the two as Hamilton appears to console his team-mate.
2018-09-30T12:45:23Z: Verstappen gets the radio equivalent of a pat on the back from team boss Christian Horner on his 21st birthday. He also led more laps than anyone else!
2018-09-30T12:44:42Z: Final order: 1 Hamilton; 2 Bottas; 3 Vettel; 4 Raikkonen; 5 Verstappen; 6 Ricciardo; 7 Leclerc; 8 Magnussen; 9 Ocon; 10 Perez; 11 Grosjean; 12 Hulkenberg; 13 Ericsson; 14 Alonso; 15 Stroll; 16 Vandoorne; 17 Sainz; 18 Sirotkin; DNF Gasly; DNF Hartley
2018-09-30T12:44:01Z: Magnussen, Ocon and Perez complete the points scorers.
2018-09-30T12:43:47Z: Ricciardo comes home a distant (but understandable) sixth ahead of Leclerc, who was a clear 'winner' in Class B and the only other driver to finish on the lead lap.
2018-09-30T12:42:13Z: Raikkonen takes fourth, 14 seconds ahead of Verstappen, who couldn't find any pace after his pitstop.
2018-09-30T12:41:45Z: Bottas takes second, staying away from the pit wall and blasting past Hamilton over the line, and Vettel takes third. Hamilton leads the championship by 50 points from Vettel now. Game over?
2018-09-30T12:41:06Z: Lewis Hamilton wins the Russian Grand Prix!
2018-09-30T12:40:49Z: Sainz gets out of the way of Bottas at Turn 2, but goes wide as a result and that allows Vandoorne through for 16th.
2018-09-30T12:40:35Z: Hamilton is told to stay off the kerbs on the final lap.
2018-09-30T12:37:30Z: 1 Hamilton, 2 Bottas, 3 Vettel, 4 Raikkonen, 5 Verstappen, 6 Ricciardo, 7 Leclerc, 8 Magnussen, 9 Ocon, 10 Perez.
2018-09-30T12:35:53Z: Bottas also puts in a 1m36.1s, and now Vettel finds himself three seconds adrift of the Silver Arrows.
2018-09-30T12:35:46Z: Ocon, by getting out of the way of the leaders before Magnussen, is a second behind the Haas now. Will he get one last chance to make a move?
2018-09-30T12:35:34Z: Now it's Hamilton sticking in a fastest lap - Mercedes just letting Ferrari know the pace is there if they need it. 1m36.137s for the man leading the race, and the world championship.
2018-09-30T12:34:13Z: Vettel makes an angry wave in the direction of the Haas of Magnussen, who he feels is getting in his way. The Ferrari has been off at Turn 4 in the process.
2018-09-30T12:33:18Z: Vettel is trying to keep the pressure up, putting in a personal best lap and forcing Bottas to respond. 3.5s cover the top three, but Mercedes seems to have it under control with five laps to go.
2018-09-30T12:32:21Z: Grosjean has passed Hulkenberg for 11th, but has 12s to make up on Perez if he wants a point. That looks a rather tall order.
2018-09-30T12:31:21Z: Bottas is always quick at this circuit. He's probably the person most bothered by it becoming a late-season race, as if it was still early in the calendar he'd have been able to win today.
2018-09-30T12:31:02Z: Leclerc, as if to make us feel guilty about forgetting to mention him more, now sets his fastest lap of the race.
2018-09-30T12:30:41Z: Nothing in it at the front in terms of laptimes - Hamilton and Bottas are doing 1m37.0s, Vettel puts in a 1m36.9s but he's 1.7s behind Bottas. All pretty calm, with Hamilton leading by 2.2s over Bottas.
2018-09-30T12:30:11Z: Leclerc is a full 13s clear of the Magnussen-Ocon-perez battle at the head of the Class B field. That's a remarkable performance in the Sauber.
2018-09-30T12:27:26Z: Hamilton leads Bottas by 1.7s, with Vettel another 1.7s back, trying to keep the Mercedes drivers honest. If the Ferrari has anything left to give, now is the time to find it.
2018-09-30T12:26:55Z: Verstappen is 14.8 seconds behind Raikkonen. That's a big ask in nine laps...
2018-09-30T12:26:41Z: While being lapped by the leaders, Hulkenberg has now dropped 13s off the back of the Force Indias and is only 2s clear of Grosjean.
2018-09-30T12:26:38Z: 1 Hamilton, 2 Bottas, 3 Vettel, 4 Raikkonen, 5 Verstappen, 6 Ricciardo, 7 Leclerc, 8 Magnussen, 9 Ocon, 10 Perez.
2018-09-30T12:25:35Z: 10 laps to go for Verstappen, and he takes a set of ultrasofts to chase down Raikkonen for fourth place to the flag.
2018-09-30T12:25:07Z: So much for staying out - Verstappen finally pits.
2018-09-30T12:24:04Z: Bottas is now just 1.3s behind Hamilton again, doing his job and keeping Vettel at bay. The Finn hasn't made that task look particularly difficult today.
2018-09-30T12:23:34Z: Hamilton lost 1.5s to Verstappen after that attack, getting held up in traffic.
2018-09-30T12:23:13Z: Ricciardo sets a new fastest lap of the race on the ultrasoft tyre - a 1m36.345s.
2018-09-30T12:22:36Z: Hamilton has a look to the inside with the help of DRS into Turn 2, but it's a half-hearted attempt and the Red Bull chops across his nose. That was a bit more nervy than it should have been for the championship leader!
2018-09-30T12:22:19Z: Hulkenberg is bemused by the suggestion a Red Bull in his mirrors is leading, but he's reassured Verstappen is yet to pit.
2018-09-30T12:21:56Z: Hamilton is turning the screw now, 0.5s behind Verstappen and in range to attack.
2018-09-30T12:21:02Z: Ricciardo pitted from sixth and emerged... in sixth. Lonely race to the finish now for the Australian.
2018-09-30T12:19:58Z: Hamilton is within two seconds of Verstappen now, and 2.3s clear of Bottas. The lead Mercedes was six tenths quicker than Verstappen last time around with a personal best lap, as Verstappen's mandatory stop looms.
2018-09-30T12:19:41Z: Red Bull tells Ricciardo it will change his nose and to expect a longer stop. He's in now.
2018-09-30T12:19:00Z: Ericsson has visited the pits again, and opts to take the ultrasoft for the remaining 15 laps.
2018-09-30T12:16:32Z: Perez has now moved back over and allowed Ocon through into ninth.
2018-09-30T12:16:22Z: Fastest lap for Hamilton - 1m37.395s. He's still 2.7s behind Verstappen, who is running a fine pace given the age of his tyres (37 laps).
2018-09-30T12:14:21Z: The Renault emerges in 11th, behind the pair of Force Indias.
2018-09-30T12:13:07Z: Hulkenberg does indeed pit from seventh.
2018-09-30T12:12:56Z: Force India are anticipating a Hulkenberg stop because Sainz has recently done just that. He's down in 16th, though, and a lap down.
2018-09-30T12:12:50Z: Another fastest lap for Raikkonen, who is 13.5s off the lead. Verstappen will rejoin a fair margin behind him when he finally stops, but the Red Bull could be in a position to attack on softer, fresher tyres.
2018-09-30T12:11:42Z: Hamilton was six tenths slower than Verstappen last time around. The gap is back up to three seconds, while the Mercedes waits for the Red Bull to pit.
2018-09-30T12:10:22Z: 1 Verstappen, 2 Hamilton, 3 Bottas, 4 Vettel, 5 Raikkonen, 6 Ricciardo, 7 Hulkenberg, 8 Leclerc, 9 Magnussen, 10 Perez.
2018-09-30T12:08:44Z: Perez hasn't really been able to get closer to Magnussen since he was allowed through by Ocon. There's around a second between them - although that gap is now out to 1.490s - as Magnussen starts to set personal bests.
2018-09-30T12:07:46Z: Vettel puts in a fastest lap of 1m37.750s, which puts him just 1.6s behind Bottas. Hamilton's tyre management means Bottas is back within 2 seconds of his team-mate.
2018-09-30T12:04:41Z: 1 Verstappen,2 Hamilton +2.8s,3 Bottas + 4.8s,4 Vettel +5.9s,5 Raikkonen +12.9s,6 Ricciardo +25.5s,
2018-09-30T12:04:06Z: Ricciardo is in absolute no man's land at the moment in sixth, 12s behind Raikkonen and 24s ahead of Hulkenberg. He's also lapping around a second slower than Verstappen, who has pretty much a pitstop's advantage over his team-mate.
2018-09-30T12:02:34Z: Promoted: Play along with Pitstop Betting. Download the app today.
2018-09-30T12:01:38Z: Raikkonen puts in a fastest lap to remind us all he's still here. He's 13 seconds off the lead, and 6.5s behind Vettel.
2018-09-30T12:00:49Z: Mercedes strategy chief James Vowles has come onto Bottas’s radio to try to sooth Mercedes’ frustrated Finn. Bottas complained that he was going to overtake Verstappen on the next lap and is annoyed Hamilton hasn’t cleared the Red Bull.Vowles, referencing Hamilton’s blister and Vettel being close behind, said: “I had to do this to make sure we secured this. I understand [your frustration].”
2018-09-30T12:00:21Z: Hamilton isn't making inroads into Verstappen at all. Perhaps, with Bottas already falling to 1.9s behind, Hamilton is going into a bit of tyre management while he waits for the Red Bull to pit. Vettel isn't offering anything in terms of threat to Bottas at the moment.
2018-09-30T11:59:30Z: Perez immediately sets his fastest lap of the race - a 1m39.713s - as he sets about closing in on Magnussen (and building enough of a buffer over Hulkenberg, who is still yet to stop).
2018-09-30T11:59:04Z: Let's complete the set of spinning Toro Rossos from earlier. Both cars were forced to retire afterwards.
2018-09-30T11:58:05Z: Force India is going to allow Perez a go at passing Magnussen, as Ocon allows his team-mate through on the run to Turn 2.
2018-09-30T11:57:43Z: Vettel is within DRS range of Bottas, but he's not yet close enough to force Hamilton's rear gunner into defensive mode.
2018-09-30T11:57:11Z: That switcheroo cost the Mercedes duo more than a full second to Verstappen, who is now 2.8s clear in the lead.
2018-09-30T11:56:30Z: Bottas pulled over to the inside at the end of the straight at Turn 13, getting out of Hamilton's way and jumping on the brakes.
2018-09-30T11:56:24Z: Gasly confirms a brake failure was the cause of his retirement.
2018-09-30T11:55:32Z: Bottas lets Hamilton through for second, at the end of the backstraight that isn't really straight at all.
2018-09-30T11:55:02Z: 1 Verstappen, 2 Bottas, 3 Hamilton, 4 Vettel, 5 Raikkonen, 6 Ricciardo.
2018-09-30T11:54:21Z: Vettel sniffs an opportunity as it all closes up ahead of him. He's just 1.3s behind Hamilton now, as Hamilton and Bottas sneak up on Verstappen.
2018-09-30T11:51:14Z: Hamilton has closed to 0.7s behind Bottas now, could the switch be coming up soon? They are just 1.6s behind Verstappen, so things could be about to get busy at the front. Vettel is more than two seconds back, so Mercedes have a little bit of space at the moment.
2018-09-30T11:50:32Z: No further action from the stewards over the Vettel/Hamilton investigation.
2018-09-30T11:49:44Z: Bottas is now just two seconds behind Verstappen. Given he has fresher tyres, and a Mercedes engine, he should be able to make pretty short work of the Red Bull when he gets there.
2018-09-30T11:49:05Z: 1 Verstappen, 2 Bottas, 3 Hamilton, 4 Vettel, 5 Raikkonen, 6 Ricciardo, 7 Hulkenberg, 8 Leclerc, 9 Magnussen, 10 Ocon.
2018-09-30T11:46:26Z: Vettel is already 1.9s behind Hamilton. With the Ferrari falling back, Hamilton has let Bottas get away a little bit too, just to calm things down for a bit and look after his tyres.
2018-09-30T11:44:57Z: Magnussen, Ocon and Perez have now all cleared Sainz.
2018-09-30T11:44:43Z: Verstappen is only 3.7s ahead of Bottas now, so he could play a role in the Mercedes v Ferrari battle at the front.
2018-09-30T11:44:12Z: Raikkonen pits, handing the lead of the race to, believe it or not, Verstappen.
2018-09-30T11:43:24Z: The stewards are having a look at Vettel's move to block Hamilton.
2018-09-30T11:42:43Z: Things are a bit more settled in the midfield now. Leclerc has got himself among the Renaults and is five seconds clear of Sainz, who is yet to stop and is slowly being caught by Magnussen, Ocon and Perez.
2018-09-30T11:42:00Z: Here's something we haven't said very often in 2018 - Ferrari just doesn't seem to have the pace.
2018-09-30T11:41:24Z: Vettel has immediately slipped to more than one second behind Hamilton.
2018-09-30T11:41:06Z: Raikkonen still hasn't stopped, so he leads by eight seconds from Verstappen. Bottas, Hamilton, Vettel is the order for the real top three at the moment.
2018-09-30T11:40:40Z: Before Hamilton stopped, Bottas was told by Mercedes to reduce his laptimes and back Vettel up. He dipped into the 1m40s but it wasn’t enough, hence Vettel still jumped Hamilton.
2018-09-30T11:40:10Z: Hamilton's not giving this up though, he gets a run through Turn 3, and jumps to the inside on the brakes for Turn 4! What a move, and Hamilton is back ahead.
2018-09-30T11:39:44Z: Hamilton gets a massive run with DRS, goes to the inside, but Vettel slams the door shut! Hamilton has to get out of it to avoid hitting the wall.
2018-09-30T11:38:59Z: Hamilton is now all over the back of Vettel in the final sector. Game on between the title contenders now.
2018-09-30T11:38:08Z: Hamilton emerges from the pits, and Vettel sweeps by before they hit the brakes for Turn 2! Vettel has jumped his championship rival in the pitstops! Bottas leads them. Wow.
2018-09-30T11:37:23Z: Clean stop for Hamilton, taking softs. Where's Vettel?
2018-09-30T11:37:10Z: Hamilton pits, as Vettel puts in a monster of a middle sector on his out-lap!
2018-09-30T11:36:58Z: Behind the leading contenders, it's only Ricciardo, Hulkenberg and Sainz who are yet to stop.
2018-09-30T11:36:18Z: Bottas is putting in best sectors of his own now, so he should rejoin back ahead of Hamilton.
2018-09-30T11:35:28Z: Hamilton turns up the wick, putting in best sector times now he has clear track.
2018-09-30T11:34:50Z: Perez was the last of those to have started on the hypersofts still out there, but has now bailed for a set of softs.
2018-09-30T11:34:42Z: Bottas rejoins five seconds behind Verstappen, but the Mercedes has tyres that are 12 laps fresher.
2018-09-30T11:34:07Z: Bottas is the first of the leaders to pit at the end of lap 12, taking on softs.
2018-09-30T11:33:34Z: Since he got up to fifth place, Verstappen has taken a few tenths out of Bottas's lead - he's now 19.3s behind the Mercedes, so those softs are holding up - as expected - much better than the race leader's ultrasofts.
2018-09-30T11:32:37Z: Here's one of those bizarre Toro Rosso spins from earlier - Hartley losing it before both cars were called in to retire.
2018-09-30T11:32:12Z: No luck for Force India, as Ocon emerges comfortably behind Magnussen.
2018-09-30T11:31:34Z: It was all clean for the Mercedes drivers at the start.
2018-09-30T11:31:32Z: Leclerc and Ocon are now in to switch to softs.
2018-09-30T11:30:25Z: Magnussen bails out of his scrap with Ocon and pits for softs. Ocon had been told to use energy to attempt a pass, but was then told to stay out to try to clear the Haas.
2018-09-30T11:29:31Z: Hamilton continues to eat into Bottas's lead now, but Vettel continues to lap faster than both. 2.8 seconds covers the top three.
2018-09-30T11:29:26Z: Replays now show Ricciardo has cleared Ericsson, so that's both Red Bulls up into the points.
2018-09-30T11:29:04Z: Ocon is still struggling to clear Magnussen, and gets a little too close for comfort to the Haas at Turn 2.
2018-09-30T11:28:42Z: Vettel is now the fastest of the leaders, he's made six tenths up on Hamilton, who has closed to one second behind Bottas. Perhaps the Ferrari was looking after his tyres before piling the pressure on.
2018-09-30T11:28:41Z: Grosjean has pitted and ditched his hypersofts for softs.
2018-09-30T11:28:04Z: Ricciardo has made more progress and is up to 11th now, having cleared Grosjean - who's struggling on his hypersofts.
2018-09-30T11:27:48Z: 1 Bottas, 2 Hamilton, 3 Vettel, 4 Raikkonen, 5 Verstappen, 6 Leclerc, 7 Magnussen, 8 Ocon, 9 Perez, 10 Ricciardo.
2018-09-30T11:27:18Z: Toro Rosso confirms both cars are out.
2018-09-30T11:27:13Z: Verstappen is only 20 seconds off the lead, having spent the opening laps making his way up from the back row of the grid.
2018-09-30T11:26:40Z: Verstappen has cleared Leclerc on the run to Turn 2, so after eight laps is up to fifth.
2018-09-30T11:26:04Z: As the Mercedes drivers trade blows at the front, Vettel has fallen to 2.5s behind Hamilton. Keeping a watching brief, or simply unable to keep up? It looks a lot like the latter.
2018-09-30T11:24:31Z: Bottas has responded to Hamilton with another fastest lap of his own, pushing the gap up slightly to 1.7s. The gap between the two is fluctuating either side of 1.5s between each sector.
2018-09-30T11:24:28Z: Verstappen is now past Magnussen for sixth.
2018-09-30T11:23:45Z: Alonso pits and rejoins in 18th on softs.
2018-09-30T11:22:38Z: More progress for Verstappen. He cleared Perez on lap five, and is now ahead of Ocon and up to seventh.
2018-09-30T11:22:13Z: Replays show both Toro Rosso drivers spinning earlier. They're both at the back of the pack, and are both in the pits.
2018-09-30T11:22:01Z: Hamilton takes over from Bottas as the fastest man on track with a 1m39.7s. He's been running 1.5s behind him, so let's see how much quicker he can go, and if he really wants to get that close to his team-mate at this stage.
2018-09-30T11:20:26Z: Ricciardo has made steadier progress than his team-mate, but is now between the Renaults in 13th.
2018-09-30T11:18:25Z: Fastest lap for Bottas  - 1m40.109s. He leads Hamilton by 1.2s.
2018-09-30T11:17:52Z: 1 Bottas, 2 Hamilton, 3 Vettel, 4 Raikkonen, 5 Leclerc, 6 Magnussen, 7 Ocon, 8 Perez, 9 Grosjean, 10 Verstappen.
2018-09-30T11:17:07Z: Things are settled at the front already at the moment, with Bottas leading from Hamilton, Vettel and Raikkonen. They are already four seconds clear of the action at the head of the 'Class B' field.
2018-09-30T11:16:47Z: Promoted: Play along with Pitstop Betting. The best odds and offers in Motorsport. Download the app today.
2018-09-30T11:16:36Z: Leclerc now goes wheel-to-wheel with Magnussen around the outside at Turn 3 and nicks fifth! Great move.
2018-09-30T11:15:44Z: Verstappen has had an excellent first lap and is already up to 13th from 19th!
2018-09-30T11:15:26Z: Bottas leads by 1.3 seconds at the end of the opening lap.
2018-09-30T11:15:18Z: That little scrap between Hamilton and Vettel has allowed Bottas, who defended from Hamilton into Turn 2, to get clear.
2018-09-30T11:15:02Z: Magnussen has held the lead at the head of the Class B battle in fifth, but Leclerc has got sixth at the expense of Ocon.
2018-09-30T11:14:53Z: Hamilton ends up alongside Bottas on the outside into Turn 2, but the Mercedes drivers get through cleanly, Vettel has another go at Hamilton before Turn 3 but he's forced to back out of it.
2018-09-30T11:14:20Z: Vettel gets alongside Hamilton off the line but the Mercedes blasts away before Turn 2!
2018-09-30T11:13:21Z: Tyre-wise, the top four all managed to get through Q2 on ultrasofts and will start on the purple-banded compound. Everyone from Magnussen back to Ericsson (fifth to 10th) is on hypersofts, the two Renaults are on softs, While the two Williams and McLarens are on ultrasofts.Gasly, Ricciardo and Verstappen are on softs, while Hartley starts on the hypersoft.
2018-09-30T11:13:03Z: The cars are lining up on the grid.
2018-09-30T11:12:09Z: Vettel is the latest driver to be told of a few spots of rain reported at Turn 10.
2018-09-30T11:11:08Z: Hamilton says he's worried he's not got enough front wing angle.
2018-09-30T11:08:46Z: Starting grid:1 Bottas2 Hamilton3 Vettel4 Raikkonen5 Magnussen6 Ocon7 Leclerc8 Perez9 Grosjean10 Ericsson11 Sainz12 Hulkenberg13 Sirotkin14 Stroll15 Vandoorne16 Alonso17 Gasly18 Ricciardo20 Verstappen19 Hartley
2018-09-30T11:04:15Z: A little bit of housekeeping for you. Stoffel Vandoorne received a penalty for a gearbox change - although the spate of engine change penalties means he only forfeits one place on the grid, to Lance Stroll, and will start 15th.
2018-09-30T11:03:33Z: Interestingly, race control has now declared there is a 40% risk of rain.
2018-09-30T11:00:42Z: There’s been light rain in the build-up to the race here at Sochi. FIA reports have all said no rain during the race. It's still warm - 23C - but definitely overcast.
2018-09-30T10:58:43Z: Will we see a repeat of this image in a couple of hours?
2018-09-30T10:58:07Z: Missed any of yesterday's qualifying action? Here's our comprehensive report on how Valtteri Bottas beat Mercedes team-mate Lewis Hamilton to pole position. Valtteri Bottas beats Lewis Hamilton to Russian Grand Prix F1 poleValtteri Bottas claimed his first Formula 1 pole position in almost three months in qualifying for the Russian Grand Prix, leading a Mercedes lockout of the front row
2018-09-30T10:55:25Z: Good morning (just), and welcome to live coverage of the Russian Grand Prix. We have 15 minutes or so until the formation lap gets underway.
